content:
本件保存
會員 委 設建 庫 水 門 石 SHIHMEN
DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
+
SDC - 5425
July 16, 1962
Mr. K. T. Li Secretary General Council for United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan
Subject: Local U. S. Surplus Equipment
Dear Mr. Li:
Based on verbal information obtained from AID/Mission, there are certain amount of U.S. Surplus equipment located at Navy Excess storage yard, Shungsan Area ready for release.
In consideration of the need of Shihmen Project, we request your arrangement with AID to make the following equipment available to Shihmen Project.
140.1.12.213.82
1. Five (5) Jeeps: For job transportation and repair parts for other available army jeeps.
2. Two (2) Dodge Weapon Carrier: For, drilling and grouting use .
3. Three (3) 6x6, 22 ton truck: For converting into concrete bucket hauling units for spillway concreting. It is to be noted that only one 22 ton truck has now been released, another one will be released for surplus very shortly. The third one is not available now, but we would like have it as soon as more truck are released.
Your immediate action will be highly appreciated.
Sincerely yours,
SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
51.7. 18
14151
V.O.
S G.
2
(3%)
(3) (2) cc: Mr. G. C. Johnson, MKA Mr. J. B. Carter, AID

Subject: Local U. S. Surplus Equipment
Based on verbal information obtained from AID/Mission,

Excess storage yard, Shungsan Area ready for release.
In consideration of the need of Shihmen Project, we request
your arrangement with AID to make the following equipment available
1. Five (5) Jeeps: For job transportation and repair parts

3. Three (3) 6x6, 22 ton truck: For converting into concrete
bucket hauling units for spillway concreting. It is to
be noted that only one 22 ton truck has now been released,
another one will be released for surplus very shortly.
The third one is not available now, but we would like have
it as soon as more truck are released.
Your immediate action will be highly appreciated.
cc: Mr. G. C. Johnson, MKA

paragraphs.content: 會員 委 設建 庫 水 門 石 SHIHMEN
Mr. K. T. Li Secretary General Council for United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan
Subject: Local U. S. Surplus Equipment
Based on verbal information obtained from AID/Mission, there are certain amount of U.S. Surplus equipment located at Navy Excess storage yard, Shungsan Area ready for release.
In consideration of the need of Shihmen Project, we request your arrangement with AID to make the following equipment available to Shihmen Project.
1. Five (5) Jeeps: For job transportation and repair parts for other available army jeeps.
2. Two (2) Dodge Weapon Carrier: For, drilling and grouting use .

3. Three (3) 6x6, 22 ton truck: For converting into concrete bucket hauling units for spillway concreting. It is to be noted that only one 22 ton truck has now been released, another one will be released for surplus very shortly. The third one is not available now, but we would like have it as soon as more truck are released.
Your immediate action will be highly appreciated.
(3) (2) cc: Mr. G. C. Johnson, MKA Mr. J. B. Carter, AID
